intro: Hippocrepis willkommiana, commonly known as the Willkomm's bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
